snippet: Two passenger trains collided at high speed in Poland late on Saturday, killing 16 people and leaving authorities asking how both trains ended up on the same track.
abstract: Death toll in high-speed, head-on collision of two passenger trains in Poland rises to 16 people; crash puts pressure on officials to discover cause of accident, with authorities questioning how both trains ended up on the same track.

byline.contributor: Anatol Magdziarz contributed reporting from Warsaw.

lead_paragraph: Two passenger trains collided at high speed in Poland late on Saturday, killing 16 people and leaving authorities asking how both trains ended up on the same track.

headline.main: Death Toll Grows to 16 in Head-On Collision of 2 Trains in Poland
headline.print_headline: Death Toll Grows to 16 in Head-On Collision of 2 Trains in Poland
